    "Time for #ChipotleMexicanGrill to face the music!
The Mexican food chain has been plagued by a series of high-profile food safety incidents, including a norovirus outbreak in California and an E. coli outbreak in the Midwest.

  • Just had my first @ChipotleTweets burrito bowl since the food safety issues... still delicious, still trusted.

😔 pic.twitter.com/7Pj5H6e4nE — The Skimm (@theskimm) December 16, 2015 I mean, it's not like they haven't had their fair share of troubles in the past (ahem, norovirus outbreak), but this whole'safety first' thing is starting to get out of hand.
First, they announced that they're going to start testing all of their employees for norovirus after multiple outbreaks.
🙄 On the bright side, at least they're taking proactive measures... even if it does mean no burritos for now.
🔥 pic.twitter.com/FQ9l8oNjL2 — Jason Calacanis (@Jason) December 16, 2015 Is Chipotle having a crisis?
What's next?
First, no carnitas for months after an investigation revealed that one of their suppliers wasn't meeting animal welfare standards.
💁‍♀️ First, there was the E. coli outbreak that affected over 50 people across 11 states.
🚨 Here are the deets: - Last week, Chipotle temporarily closed a location in Boston after several students from nearby Boston College fell ill with symptoms similar to norovirus.
🤣 First, they closed 43 locations in Washington and Oregon after customers got sick from eating at the restaurants.
Like, what's next?
😂 #chipotlecloses #food coma — Alisha Robertson (@AlishaRober) December 17, 2015 Oh no!
🙅‍♀️ What do you think?
💯💔 In all seriousness, better safe than sorry, right?
First, they were forced to shut down a location in Washington D.C. after a customer reported finding a rodent in their burrito (eww).

👀 First, there was the whole 'closing 43 locations in Washington and Oregon due to E. coli outbreak' thing... 🚫 Then, there were reports of customers getting sick from eating at Chipotle in Minnesota, Wisconsin, and California.
First, they shut down all locations for a few hours in November to hold a company-wide meeting about food safety protocols.
🤦‍♀️👀 First, there was the norovirus outbreak at a California location in August.
First, there was the E. coli outbreak that led to a temporary closure of some locations.
🚫 In all seriousness, though, it's good that they're taking these precautions to ensure customer safety.
🤦‍♀️ What do you think?

First, there was the news that they're going to start using pre-cut tomatoes instead of chopping them fresh in-store because of all the food safety concerns... which, let's be real, kind of defeats the purpose of eating at Chipotle in the first place.

👀 First, they shut down all locations nationwide for a few hours to re-train employees on food safety protocols... and now, they're recalling over 6,000 pounds of chorizo because it might contain... wait for it... pork shoulder!

Just when you think it's safe to go back in the burrito-filled waters... 🚣‍♂️😷 #ChipotleProbs

First, they announce that they'll be closing all US locations for a few hours on February 8th to address food safety concerns and retrain employees...and now THIS
First, there was the E. coli outbreak in October that led to 45 reported cases of food poisoning across six states.

💸💸💸— Aminatou Sow (@aminatou) December 17, 2015 According to reports, Chipotle is planning to retrain all its employees on food safety procedures and will be implementing new protocols for handling ingredients and preparing food.
First, there was that one store that got shut down because of a rat problem.
👀🍴 — The Daily Bite (@thedailybite) December 17, 2015 According to BuzzFeed News, Chipotle shut down one location after a customer reported finding a cockroach in their food.
First, there was the E. coli scare, then some Salmonella contamination, and let's not forget about the hepatitis A outbreak... it's like the universe is conspiring against our beloved burritos!
According to Bloomberg, Chipotle Mexican Grill has closed an estimated 43 stores across Seattle and Portland after health officials linked them to an E. coli outbreak.
🤷‍♀️🍽️ #chipotlegate #burritogeddon — 💁‍♀️ (@Sarcastrology) December 16, 2015 So apparently @ChipotleTweets thinks shutting down for lunch is better than serving bad food?
😳 According to a statement released by Chipotle, all locations will undergo a comprehensive food safety review, including re-training for employees on proper food handling and preparation procedures.
Just kidding, food safety is super important and all that jazz...
First, they took away our beloved Chorizo (RIP).

You don't mess with the safety and quality control of our beloved fast-casual Mexican food chain.
💯 But still, can we please just have our guacamole back?
😂 But seriously, let's hope for a speedy recovery from these setbacks, and back to our usual guac-filled lives.
🙅‍♂️ Guess we'll all just have to wait patiently for them to get their act together again.
🙅‍♂️ So what's next for Chipotle?
Will they bounce back from this latest setback or continue to struggle?
Will they bounce back from this most recent setback or continue to struggle?
Well, the brand has announced plans to implement new safety protocols, including more rigorous testing and inspections, additional employee training, and even making menu items easier to clean.
🚮 It's going to be a long road to recovery for Chipotle, but if anyone can bounce back from this, it's probably them.
🚮 Let's hope these efforts pay off and our Chipotle cravings can finally be satiated without worrying about, you know, getting sick.
🍴💯 As for us consumers, well... let's just say we're all about that guac life – as long as it's safe, of course!
🌮 And while all these changes might make your burrito bowl taste slightly bitter, at least you can trust that it won't give you a stomachache... or worse.
👊 We're rooting for you, Chipotle!
✨ But let's be real, folks: no matter how hard they try to revamp their image, there will always be haters out there trying to bring them down.
💪 It looks like they're taking customer concerns seriously and working hard to regain our trust.
🍲💪 But let's be real – it's gonna take a lot more than that to win back the trust (and appetites) of its loyal customers.
👍 In the meantime, let's all take a deep breath, put on our big boy/girl pants, and face the reality: no burritos or bowls for us... for now.
💪 It's clear that Chipotle is taking steps to rebuild trust with its customers, but will it be enough to win back those who have lost faith?
💪 Fingers crossed that these changes will help put an end to all the drama!
Sounds like a solid plan, if you ask me!
